zaraz.msgs.no_tools: No tools are currently configured to load.
zaraz.overview.tools.title: Third-party tools
zaraz.overview.tools.subtitle: Manage third-party tools for your site.
zaraz.overview.triggers.title: Triggers
zaraz.overview.triggers.subtitle: Triggers are signals that can define precisely when to start actions in your third-parties.
zaraz.overview.consent.title: Consent Management
zaraz.overview.consent.subtitle: These settings will affect the consent modal on your website
zaraz.page_header.subtitle: Run third-party scripts from the cloud
zaraz.catalog.subtitle: Choose the tools you would like to use in your website.
zaraz.tool.add_field.label: Field name
zaraz.tool.name: Name
zaraz.add_new_tool_modal.title: Add new tool
zaraz.add_new_tool_modal.description: Are you sure you want to continue with configuring
zaraz.tool.setup.name.label: Tool name
zaraz.tool.setup.name.description: Use the default name or give your tool a custom one, if necessary
zaraz.tool.details.settings.title: Tool Settings
zaraz.tool.details.settings.subtitle: These settings affect all actions fired by this tool.
zaraz.tool.details.settings.none: No settings are set for this tool
zaraz.tool.details.events.title: Tool actions
zaraz.tool.details.events.name: Action Name
zaraz.tool.details.events.empty: No actions are currently configured for this tool.
zaraz.tool.details.events.subtitle: Define what this third-party tool does and under what conditions.
zaraz.tool.details.events.form.new.title: New action
This name will only be used in the Zaraz interface to help you identify your action. It has no effect on the actual data that Zaraz will send to this tool.
zaraz.tool.details.permissions.descripti: Define which permission you would like to grant to this tool.
zaraz.tool.details.permission.access_cli: Read and save information in browsers using cookies and storage
zaraz.tool.details.permission.access_ext: Read and save information belonging to other components using cookies and storage
zaraz.tool.details.permission.execute_un: Allows this tool to execute potentially unsafe Javascript in the browser. Make sure you trust this tool. This tool cannot be set up without this permission enabled.
zaraz.tool.details.permission.serve_stat: Serve static assets from your domain
zaraz.tool.details.permission.provide_se: Expose HTTP endpoints on your domain
zaraz.tool.details.permission.required: This tool cannot be set up without this permission enabled.
zaraz.tool.details.permissions.title: Tool permissions
zaraz.tool.legacy.label: Legacy
zaraz.tool.legacy.label.tooltip: This tool was created as a legacy tool. It can now be recreated as a managed component, allowing more granular permissions.
zaraz.trigger.form.new.title: Create Trigger
zaraz.trigger.details.name: Trigger Name
zaraz.trigger.details.edit.title: Edit Trigger
zaraz.trigger.details.edit.subtitle: Editing a trigger propagates changes to all the Actions using this trigger
zaraz.trigger.details.create.title: Create Trigger
zaraz.trigger.details.create.subtitle: Use this trigger for setting at least one action to see it working
zaraz.trigger.details.rules.title: Match Rules
zaraz.trigger.details.rules.subtitle: Trigger rules determine the conditions under which this trigger would fire.
zaraz.trigger.details.rules.sub_subtitle: All rules must match for the trigger to start.
zaraz.trigger.details.rules.loadRule.var: The name of the variable you want to match against
zaraz.trigger.details.rules.loadRule.mat: The comparison operator to use when matching against the variable
The value that should match your selected variable
zaraz.trigger.details.rules.clickListene: The selector to use when matching against the DOM
Wait for Zaraz to complete processing all tools before executing the original click action for up to this number of milliseconds. Leave as 0 to disable waiting
zaraz.trigger.details.rules.elementVisib: The CSS selector to use when matching against the DOM
zaraz.trigger.details.rules.formSubmissi: The CSS selector to use when matching against the DOM
Only fire the trigger if the matching form(s) has no validation errors
A comma-separated list of positions in px (pixels) or % (percentages)
zaraz.trigger.details.rules.timer.interv: The interval in milliseconds between firing the trigger
The number of times the trigger should fire before stopping
zaraz.trigger.details.rules.type.tooltip: The type of rule to use
zaraz.trigger.delete_modal.title: Delete trigger
zaraz.trigger.delete_modal.description: Are you sure you want to delete this trigger?
zaraz.trigger.delete.tooltip: Triggers can't be deleted while still in use
zaraz.event.delete_modal.description: Are you sure you want to delete this action?
zaraz.event.delete_modal.title: Delete action
zaraz.event.details.error.duplicate_name: This Action Name already exists. Choose a new Action Name
zaraz.settings.debugKey.title: Debug key
zaraz.settings.debugKey.description: Use zaraz.debug(DEBUG_KEY) with this key to enable Debug Mode
zaraz.settings.title: Settings
zaraz.settings.subtitle: These settings will affect all your Zaraz tools.
zaraz.settings.workflow.title: Workflow type
zaraz.settings.workflow.disabled.tooltip: This feature is available for users with Workers Paid plan
zaraz.settings.workflow.modal.title: Switch to Real-time workflow
zaraz.settings.workflow.modal.descriptio: Please choose what to do with your current pending changes on Preview mode
zaraz.settings.workflow.description: Choose whether the changes should take effect Real-time when making them, or Preview the changes on your website before Publishing them to all users.
zaraz.workflow.actions.publish.tooltip: You are working in Preview mode. Click Publish if you want to push the changes live.
zaraz.workflow.actions.publish.tooltipNo: You do not have publish permissions.
zaraz.workflow.modal.description: Are you sure you would like to publish the current Zaraz config state?
zaraz.workflow.modal.enter_description: Please add a description of the changes made
zaraz.settings.historyChange.title: Single Page Application support
zaraz.settings.historyChange.description: Automatically use the "Pageview" trigger upon SPA navigation
zaraz.settings.autoInjectScript.title: Auto-inject script
zaraz.settings.autoInjectScript.descript: Automatically inject the Zaraz Initialization script into the page
zaraz.settings.dataLayer.title: Data layer compatibility mode
zaraz.settings.ecommerce.title: E-commerce tracking
zaraz.settings.ecommerce.description: Enable the Zaraz E-commerce Tracking API
zaraz.settings.injectIframes.title: Iframe injection
zaraz.settings.injectIframes.description: Also inject the Zaraz Initialization script in iframe elements. Depends on "Auto-inject script" being switched on.
zaraz.settings.invalidPath: Please enter a valid path, e.g. "/my/path"
zaraz.settings.initPath.title: Initialization script
zaraz.settings.initPath.description: Path to the Zaraz initialization script. Leave empty to use default, /cdn-cgi/zaraz/i.js
zaraz.settings.scriptPath.title: Main script
zaraz.settings.scriptPath.description: Path to the Zaraz main script. Leave empty to use default, /cdn-cgi/zaraz/s.js
zaraz.settings.trackPath.title: Track endpoint
zaraz.settings.trackPath.description: Path to send all tracking requests. Leave empty to use default, /cdn-cgi/zaraz/t
zaraz.settings.eventsApiPath.title: HTTP Events API
zaraz.settings.eventsApiPath.description: Path to send all server-side track events. Leave empty to disable the endpoint.
zaraz.purpose.form.new.title: Create Purpose
zaraz.purpose.details.create.subtitle: Purposes let you group data processing activities
zaraz.purpose.name.label: Purpose name
zaraz.purpose.description.label: Description
zaraz.settings.hideQueryParams.title: Remove URL query parameters
zaraz.settings.hideQueryParams.descripti: Remove all query parameters from URLs, turning https://example.com/?q=hello to https://example.com/
zaraz.settings.hideIPAddress.title: Trim IP addresses
zaraz.settings.hideIPAddress.description: Trim IP addreses before passing them to server-side loaded tools
zaraz.settings.hideExternalReferer.title: Remove external referers
zaraz.settings.hideExternalReferer.descr: Hide the page referer URL if its hostname is different from the website's
zaraz.settings.hideUserAgent.title: Clean User Agent strings
zaraz.settings.hideUserAgent.description: Clear sensitive information from the User Agent string by removing versions, extensions and additional information
zaraz.consent.enabled.label: Enable Consent Management
zaraz.consent.enabled.description: Present a Consent modal and enforce consent settings
zaraz.purposes.cannot_delete: You can't delete this purpose as it is assigned to one or more tools below
zaraz.consent.settings.administratorIden: Name of the legal entity representing the administrator of your website. It will be displayed within the modal.
zaraz.consent.settings.administratorEmai: The email address to which GDPR-related questions about your website can be sent. It will be displayed in the consent modal.
zaraz.consent.settings.companyStreetAddr: The street address of the company. It will be displayed in the consent modal.
zaraz.consent.modalWillReappear: Note: Adding a purpose will make the consent modal re-appear for users who already made their choices
zaraz.consent.missingIntro: Please fill in the Consent Modal text in order for Consent Management to be enabled.
zaraz.purposes.explain: Reasons for using third-party tools in your website.
zaraz.assignPurposes.explain: Tools that require consent needs to be assigned to a purpose. Tools that are not assigned will be enabled regardless of the consent status.
zaraz.consent.defaultIntroWarning: This content was generated automatically. You are responsible for ensuring that the above language complies with applicable privacy laws.
zaraz.variables.system.page.query..descr: Returns the value of a URL query parameter. When you choose this variable, you need to set the name of your parameter.
zaraz.variables.system.page.url.search.d: Returns query parameters provided, beginning with the leading ? character.
zaraz.variables.system.page.url.pathname: Returns the path of the URL, including the initial /. Does not include the query string or fragment.
zaraz.variables.system.page.url.port.des: Returns the port number of the URL.
zaraz.variables.system.page.url.hostname: Returns the domain of the URL.
zaraz.variables.system.page.url.host.des: Returns the domain (that is, the hostname) followed by a : and the port of the URL (if a port was specified).
zaraz.variables.system.page.url.password: Returns the password specified before the domain name.
zaraz.variables.system.page.url.username: Returns the username specified before the domain name.
zaraz.variables.system.page.url.protocol: Returns the protocol scheme of the URL, including the final :.
zaraz.variables.system.page.url.origin.d: Returns the origin of the URL u2014 that is, its scheme, domain, and port.
zaraz.variables.system.page.url.href.des: Returns a string containing the entire URL.
zaraz.variables.system.page.url.baseDoma: Returns the base domain part of the URL, without any subdomains.
zaraz.variables.system.page.encoding.des: Returns the document character encoding from document.characterSet.
zaraz.variables.system.cookies..descript: Returns cookies obtained from the browser document.
zaraz.variables.system.device.resolution: Returns the screen resolution of the device.
zaraz.variables.system.device.viewport.d: Returns the visible web page area in useru2019s device.
Returns the type of browser engine (for example, WebKit).
Returns the version of the browseru2019s engine.
Returns the version of the operating system.
Returns the type of device used (for example, iPhone).
zaraz.variables.system.device.location.c: Returns the country code of the incoming request. For example, PT.
zaraz.variables.system.device.location.r: Returns the ISO 3166-2 name for the first level region associated with the IP address of the incoming request. For example, Lisbon.
zaraz.variables.system.device.location.c: Returns the city of the incoming request. For example, Lisbon.
zaraz.variables.system.device.location.r: Returns the ISO 3166-2 region code associated with the IP address of the incoming request. For example, 11.
zaraz.variables.system.device.location.c: Returns the continent of the incoming request. For example, EU
zaraz.variables.system.device.location.i: Returns a 1 if the country of the incoming request is in the European Union, and a 0 if it is not.
zaraz.variables.system.device.location.t: Returns the timezone of the incoming request. For example, Europe/Lisbon.
zaraz.variables.system.misc.random.descr: Returns a random number unique to each request.
zaraz.variables.system.misc.timestamp.de: Returns the Unix time in seconds.
zaraz.variables.system.misc.timestampMil: Returns the Unix time in milliseconds.
zaraz.variables.client.__zarazTrack.desc: Returns the name of the event sent using the Track method of the Web API. Refer to the Track method for more information.
zaraz.variables.client..description: Returns the value of a zaraz.track() eventProperties key. The key can either be directly used in zaraz.track() or set using zaraz.set(). Set the name of your key here. Refer to the Set method for more information.
zaraz.variables.client.scrollDepth.descr: For Scroll Depth triggers, returns the Scroll Position.
zaraz.variables.client.id.description: For Click Listener triggers, returns the element ID attribute.
zaraz.variables.client.href.description: For Click Listener triggers, returns the element HREF attribute.
zaraz.variables.client.class.description: For Click Listener triggers, returns the element CLASS attribute.
zaraz.variables.system.page.title: Page title
zaraz.variables.modal.title: Set property name
zaraz.consent.customCSS.explain: The styles will be appended to the modal so you can make it look in line with your brand
zaraz.consent.customModalIntro.explain: The HTML code you put in here will be injected at the top of the consent modal. You can use this field to inform the user about your legal identity and link to your Privacy Policy, for example.
zaraz.overview.variables.title: Variables
zaraz.overview.variables.subtitle: Variables are reusable blocks you can use when configuring your tools and triggers.
zaraz.variable.form.new.title: Create Variable
zaraz.variable.name: Variable name
zaraz.variables.none: Click "Create variable" button to create your first variable
zaraz.variable.delete_modal.description: Are you sure you want to delete this variable?
zaraz.variable.delete_modal.title: Delete variable
zaraz.variable.details.edit.title: Edit Variable
zaraz.variable.details.edit.subtitle: Editing a variable propagates changes to all the Actions using this variable
zaraz.variables.delete.tooltip: Variables can't be deleted while still in use
zaraz.variables.edit.secret: Secret Variables cannot be modified at a later time
zaraz.field.validation.url.pattern.error: Please enter a valid URL string
zaraz.field.validation.revenue.pattern.e: Please enter an integer or a decimal value with a point as a separator.
zaraz.overview.monitoring.title: Monitoring
zaraz.overview.monitoring.subtitle: Zaraz Monitoring helps you understand how the different parts of the Zaraz system perform.
zaraz.monitoring.disabled: Monitoring access is not enabled for your zone
zaraz.monitoring.loads.subtitle: Loads counts how many times Zaraz was loaded on pages of your website. When Single Page Application support is toggled on, it will count every change of navigation as well.
zaraz.monitoring.track.subtitle: Track counts how many times a specific event was tracked by Zaraz. It includes the Pageview event, Track events and E-commerce events.
zaraz.monitoring.triggers.subtitle: Triggers counts how many times a specific trigger was activated. It includes the built-in Pageview trigger, and any other trigger you set in Zaraz.
zaraz.monitoring.actions.subtitle: Actions counts how many times a specific Action was activated. It includes pre-configured Pageview actions, and any other action you set in Zaraz.
zaraz.sparklines.title: Activity last 24hr
zaraz.monitoring.filters.name: Name
zaraz.pagination.perPage.label: Rows per page
zaraz.version_history.title: Version History
zaraz.version_history.subtitle: View and manage published versions of your Zaraz configuration
zaraz.version_history.no_records: There are no previous versions to show
zaraz.version_history.success: Version restored successfully. Please publish your changes.
zaraz.version_history.rever_warning: Are you sure you want to revert your Zaraz config to this version?
zaraz.toast.publish.success: A new version of your Zaraz configuration has been published successfully
zaraz.toast.publish.error: There was a problem publishing your Zaraz configuration
zaraz.banner.httpapi: **New!** Use the [HTTP Events API](https://developers.cloudflare.com/zaraz/http-events-api/) to send events to Zaraz directly from your server, mobile app, or anywhere else!
zaraz.banner.previewpublish: **New!** [Preview & Publish Workflow](https://developers.cloudflare.com/zaraz/advanced/preview-mode/) lets you test your changes before applying them, access change history and rollback whenever you need!
zaraz.prompt.unsaved.changes: You have some unsaved changes. Are you sure you want to leave the page?
zaraz.premium.fields.disabled.title: Premium features updated
zaraz.premium.fields.disabled.descriptio:
You are going to disable the following premium features: 
%{features}

Once you confirm, they will be available to you only if you update to Zaraz Paid or Enterprise plan.

Are you sure you want to proceed?
zaraz.premium.field.updated.validation.e: This field is part of premium features. You can only keep its value as is or reset it, but you cannot change. Upgrade your plan to gain full access.
zaraz.html.gtm: Looks like you're trying to use Google Tag Manager with Zaraz. This could damage the performance of your site. Click to learn more.
zaraz.html.other_tool: Did you know Zaraz has a native %{tool} integration? It's faster and safer than Custom HTML. Click to learn more.
zaraz.settings.import-export.title: Import & Export
zaraz.settings.export.title: Export configuration
zaraz.settings.export.description: Export your latest published configuration for using as a backup, or in order to copy the configuration to another website.
zaraz.settings.import.title: Import configuration
zaraz.settings.import.description: Import a previously exported Zaraz configuration, replacing all current configuration such as tools, actions, variables and triggers.
zaraz.settings.reset.title: Reset configuration
zaraz.settings.reset.description: Resetting your Zaraz configuration will erase all settings, including tools, actions, variables and triggers.
zaraz.settings.import.modal.description: Importing a new Zaraz configuration would replace your current one. All your current triggers, tools, variables and settings will be removed and the new configuration will be used instead.
zaraz.settings.reset.modal.description: Resetting your Zaraz configuration would erase all of your Zaraz configuration, including your triggers, tools, variables and settings. Zaraz will not work on your website until you reconfigure it.
zaraz.settings.reset.modal.test: To confirm, please enter your zone name (%{zone}) and press confirm if you are sure.
